page.title: 04Longfield Hill Women's Inst.
page.content: Longfield Hill Womens Institute is a club formed fifty_five years ago and has a membership of seventy_one.Ages range from eighty_five down to a young mother who brings her four year old daughter. The club meets on the second Thursday of every month at 1:45pm in the Scout Hut, Longfield Hill, which is a small community on the boundary of Longfield village. It boasts a village green complete with old mission church building, two picturesque thatched cottages, an old pub which was recently modernised to become a popular steak house. The community is sufficiently rural to have a bus service only on Fridays. New Barn, one and a half miles nearer Longfield has been much built up over the last twenty years and provides a catchment area for recruitment.
